arm_group.description: Skin sensor will be placed on the side that had surgery first.
Skin sensor will be placed on the contralateral side from surgery site first.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to assess the role of skin sensors in obtaining reliable and
      accurate serial measurements of skin parameters in the context of cutaneous skin wound
      healing.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Skin and Muscle Parameters Using a Skin Sensor

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Males and Females age 18 and over

          -  Recent (post-operative day 0-90) skin surgery of the trunk,extremities, head or neck
             for minor skin problems resulting in sutured wounds or open granulating wounds.

          -  Otherwise good general health as assessed by the investigator

          -  The subject has the willingness and the ability to understand and provide informed
             consent for the use of their tissue and communicate with the investigator.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Under 18 years of age

          -  Pregnancy or Lactation

          -  Subjects who are unable to understand the protocol or to give informed consent

facility.name: Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine, Department of Dermatology

clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study of Skin and Muscle Parameters Using a Multifunctional Skin Sensor

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 48 hours from baseline, 2 weeks from baseline, and 30 days from baseline

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor in Dermatology, Otolaryngology- Head and Neck Surgery and Surgery-Organ Transplantation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
